member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Host.Blobs.Listeners.StorageAnalyticsLogParser
member.summary: Implements parsing of Storage Analytics Log file.
member.remarks: Storage Analytics Log Format defined at http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/hh343259.aspx

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Host.Blobs.Listeners.StorageAnalyticsLogParser.ParseLogAsync(Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.Blob.ICloudBlob,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Given a log file (as a blob), parses it and return a collection of log entries matching version 1.0 of the Storage Analytics Log Format.
member.param: Object representing a cloud blob with Storage Analytics log content.
A token to monitor for cancellation request.
member.returns: Collection of successfully parsed log entries.
member.exception: If unable to parse a line in given log.
member.remarks: The method scans log file lines one at a time. First it attempts to detect a line format version and throws an exception if failed to do so. It skips all lines with version different than supported one, i.e. 1.0. Then it calls TryParseLogEntry to create a log entry out of every line of supported version and throws an exception if the parse method returns null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Host.Blobs.Listeners.StorageAnalyticsLogParser.TryParseVersion(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to parse first field of a log line assuming it's in 'Major.Minor' version format followed by ';'
member.param: A line as extracted from a Storage Analytics Log file.
member.returns: Parsed instance of or null if parsing has failed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Host.Blobs.Listeners.StorageAnalyticsLogParser.TryParseLogEntry(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to parse a single line of Storage Analytics Log file using Regex matches.
member.param: A line as extracted from a Storage Analytics Log file. Must not be null or empty.
member.returns: Parsed instance of if the given line matches expected format of the Storage Analytics Log v1.0, or null otherwise.

As this method handles out byte array parameter it distinguishes following possible scenarios:
If the value is , no message will be sent.
If the value is an empty byte array, a message with empty content will be sent.
If the value is a non-empty byte array, a message with content from given argument will be sent.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.JobHostConfiguration.HostId
member.summary: Gets or sets the host ID.

remarks.para: All host instances that share the same host ID must be homogeneous. For example, they must use the same storage accounts and have the same list of functions. Host instances with the same host ID will scale out and share handling of work such as BlobTrigger and run from dashboard processing and providing a heartbeat to the dashboard indicating that an instance of the host running.
If this value is , a host ID will automatically be generated based on the assembly name of the first function.

If non-homogeneous host instances share the same first function assembly, this property must be set explicitly; otherwise, the host instances will incorectly try to share work as if they were homogeneous.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Host.Blobs.BlobCausalityManager
member.summary: Tracks which function wrote each blob via blob metadata.
member.remarks: This may be risky because it does interfere with the function (and the user could tamper with it or accidentally remove it). An alternative mechanism would be to have a look-aside table. But that's risky because it's a separate object to manage and could get out of sync.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Host.Queues.QueueCausalityManager
member.summary: Tracks causality via JSON formatted queue message content. Adds an extra field to the JSON object for the parent guid name.
member.remarks: Important that this class can interoperate with external queue messages, so be resilient to a missing guid marker. Can we switch to some auxillary table? Beware, CloudQueueMessage. Id is not filled out until after the message is queued, but then there's a race between updating the aux storage and another function picking up the message.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Host.Blobs.Listeners.StorageAnalyticsLogColumnId
member.summary: Zero-based index of fields in a Storage Analytics Log entry format consumed by the WebJobs SDK.
member.remarks:
Each version 1.0 log entry adheres to the following format:
<version-number>;<request-start-time>;<operation-type>;<request-status>;<http-status-code>;<end-to-end-latency-in-ms>;<server-latency-in-ms>;<authentication-type>;<requester-account-name>;<owner-account-name>;<service-type>;<request-url>;<requested-object-key>;<request-id-header>;<operation-count>;<requester-ip-address>;<request-version-header>;<request-header-size>;<request-packet-size>;<response-header-size>;<response-packet-size>;<request-content-length>;<request-md5>;<server-md5>;<etag-identifier>;<last-modified-time>;<conditions-used>;<user-agent-header>;<referrer-header>;<client-request-id>
Storage Analytics Log Format defined at http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/hh343259.aspx
